turns.speaker: JEROME
turns.text: Not thirsty?  We've got enough virgin samples to last us the week.

turns.speaker: EUGENE
turns.text: I don't feel too good.  I think I'm still drunk from last night.

turns.speaker: JEROME
turns.text: Never stopped you before.  And for God's sake stop plucking your hair. Someone went to a lot of trouble to make sure you wouldn't go bald.

turns.speaker: EUGENE
turns.text: If I were you I'd worry about myself.  Haven't you forgotten something?

turns.speaker: EUGENE
turns.text: How was your evening?

turns.speaker: JEROME
turns.text: Complicated.  I couldn't stop her apologizing.

turns.speaker: EUGENE
turns.text: You are a catch. No doubt she's worried that she would lower the standard of your offspring. Everybody wants to "breed up". What's wrong with her?

turns.speaker: JEROME
turns.text: You know how it is with these altered births --somebody told her she's not going to live forever and she's been preparing to die ever since.

turns.speaker: EUGENE
turns.text: You're not thinking of telling her, are you?

turns.speaker: JEROME
turns.text: Of course not.  But she's have to know eventually.

turns.speaker: EUGENE
turns.text: She doesn't have to know. She doesn't want to know.

turns.speaker: EUGENE
turns.text: Where are we going?

turns.speaker: JEROME
turns.text: I'm sorry.  I've got plans.

turns.speaker: EUGENE
turns.text: Again?

turns.speaker: JEROME
turns.text: She's already got her doubts.  I have to act like nothing's wrong.

turns.speaker: EUGENE
turns.text: I'm sure you'll be very convincing.

turns.speaker: EUGENE
turns.text: Where are you taking her?

turns.speaker: JEROME
turns.text: Michael's.

turns.speaker: JEROME
turns.text: Everybody goes there.

turns.speaker: EUGENE
turns.text: You may as well invite her here.

turns.speaker: JEROME
turns.text: Will you be okay?

turns.speaker: EUGENE
turns.text: Don't worry about your little pin cushion. To be honest, I'm looking forward to having the place to myself.

turns.speaker: JEROME
turns.text: We'll still be able to talk when I'm away. The conversation will just keep getting longer.

turns.speaker: EUGENE
turns.text: How long?

turns.speaker: JEROME
turns.text: By the time I'm at the Belt, you phone and say, "How are you?"  Forty-five minutes later I reply, "Not bad.  How are you?"

turns.speaker: EUGENE
turns.text: I guess I'd better have something important to say if it takes that long to get an answer.

turns.speaker: EUGENE
turns.text: Hello?

turns.speaker: JEROME
turns.text: How would you like to be yourself for the day?

turns.speaker: EUGENE
turns.text: I was never very good at it, remember?

turns.speaker: JEROME
turns.text: How are you, Jerome?

turns.speaker: EUGENE
turns.text: Not bad, Jerome.

turns.speaker: JEROME
turns.text: How the hell did you get here.

turns.speaker: EUGENE
turns.text: I could always walk.  I've been faking it.

turns.speaker: EUGENE
turns.text: I have your samples ready.

turns.speaker: JEROME
turns.text: Have you forgotten?  I don't need any samples where I'm going.

turns.speaker: EUGENE
turns.text: No, but you might need them when you get back.

turns.speaker: JEROME
turns.text: Why have you done this?

turns.speaker: EUGENE
turns.text: In case you get back before I do.

turns.speaker: JEROME
turns.text: Where are you going?

turns.speaker: EUGENE
turns.text: I'm travelling too.

turns.speaker: JEROME
turns.text: Thank you.

turns.speaker: EUGENE
turns.text: I got the better end of the deal.  I just lent you my body--you lent me your dream.

turns.speaker: GENETICIST
turns.text: First, we may as well decide on gender. Have you given it any thought?

turns.speaker: MARIA
turns.text: We would like Vincent to have a brother... you know, to play with.

turns.speaker: GENETICIST
turns.text: You've already specified blue eyes, dark hair and fair skin.  I have taken the liberty of eradicating any potentially prejudicial conditions - premature baldness, myopia, alcoholism and addictive susceptibility, propensity for violence and obesity--

turns.speaker: MARIA
turns.text: --We didn't want--diseases, yes.

turns.speaker: GENETICIST
turns.text: Anything I've forgotten?

turns.speaker: MARIA
turns.text: We want him--we were hoping he would get married and have children.  We'd like grandchildren.

turns.speaker: GENETICIST
turns.text: I understand.  That's already been taken care of.  Now you appreciate I can only work with the raw material I have at my disposal but for a little extra...I could also attempt to insert sequences associated with enhanced mathematical or musical ability.

turns.speaker: MARIA
turns.text: Antonio, the choir...

turns.speaker: GENETICIST
turns.text: I have to caution you it's not fool-proof. With multi-gene traits there can be no guarantees.

turns.speaker: MARIA
turns.text: What will happen to the others?

turns.speaker: GENETICIST
turns.text: They are not babies, Maria, merely "human possibilities".

turns.speaker: VINCENT
turns.text: What do you think?

turns.speaker: GERMAN
turns.text: I think I could do something  provided you know what you're doing and you can meet the terms.

turns.speaker: GERMAN
turns.text: Vincent...Vincent...

turns.speaker: VINCENT
turns.text: German, is that you?

turns.speaker: GERMAN
turns.text: Vincent, come down.  I've found him.

turns.speaker: GERMAN
turns.text: He has the heart of an ox.  He could run through a Goddamn wall--if he could still run. Actually, he was a big college swimming star.

turns.speaker: VINCENT
turns.text: I hope he's not just a body.

turns.speaker: GERMAN
turns.text: No problem.  Before he dropped out he was an honor student, the right majors--

turns.speaker: VINCENT
turns.text: How do I square the accident?

turns.speaker: GERMAN
turns.text: It happened in Australasia. He checked in yesterday. No family complications, no record he ever broke his neck. As far as anybody's concerned, he's still a walking, talking, fully-productive member of society. You just have to get him off the pipe and fill in the last two years of his life. Excuse me, your life.

turns.speaker: VINCENT
turns.text: That's the hair color in his profile?

turns.speaker: GERMAN
turns.text: Yeah.

turns.speaker: VINCENT
turns.text: I'd have to bleach my hair.

turns.speaker: GERMAN
turns.text: Why are you inventing problems?  You two are a couple of goddam clones.  You look so right together, I want to double my fee.

turns.speaker: VINCENT
turns.text: How tall are you?

turns.speaker: GERMAN
turns.text: You can wear lifts.

turns.speaker: VINCENT
turns.text: Even with lifts I'm never that tall.

turns.speaker: GERMAN
turns.text: There's a way.

turns.speaker: HUGO
turns.text: My wife and I--we're thinking of starting a family.

turns.speaker: INVESTIGATOR
turns.text: Why not?

turns.speaker: HUGO
turns.text: These new personality corrections I've been reading about.

turns.speaker: INVESTIGATOR
turns.text: You worried about the cost?

turns.speaker: HUGO
turns.text: Not that.

turns.speaker: INVESTIGATOR
turns.text: They said the same thing about myopia and obesity. You think your children would be less human if they were less violent, angry, spiteful? Maybe they'd be more human. From where I sit the world could stand a little improving.

turns.speaker: INVESTIGATOR
turns.text: Hugo!  I've found him!

turns.speaker: HUGO
turns.text: I've found him too.

turns.speaker: INVESTIGATOR
turns.text: A fingerprint.  There's something to be said for nostalgia.  What did you find?

turns.speaker: JEROME
turns.text: No bother.

turns.speaker: IRENE
turns.text: I've been asked to compile a log for the investigators--they want to know everyone's whereabouts last night.

turns.speaker: JEROME
turns.text: Last night?  I was at home.

turns.speaker: IRENE
turns.text: Can that be, er, verified?  Were you alone?

turns.speaker: JEROME
turns.text: No it can't be verified.  Yes I was alone.

turns.speaker: JEROME
turns.text: Looks bad, doesn't it, Irene? What about you? Where were you last night?

turns.speaker: IRENE
turns.text: I was at home.

turns.speaker: JEROME
turns.text: Were you alone?

turns.speaker: IRENE
turns.text: Yes.

turns.speaker: JEROME
turns.text: So we don't know for sure about you, either.

turns.speaker: IRENE
turns.text: No.

turns.speaker: JEROME
turns.text: Why don't we say we were together?

turns.speaker: IRENE
turns.text: Why would we do that?

turns.speaker: JEROME
turns.text: I have better things to do this week than answer the foolish questions of some flatfoot. Don't you?

turns.speaker: IRENE
turns.text: I'm sorry.  I didn't mean anything.

turns.speaker: JEROME
turns.text: We were just looking.

turns.speaker: IRENE
turns.text: I know about you.

turns.speaker: JEROME
turns.text: Have they found our friend?

turns.speaker: IRENE
turns.text: Friend?

turns.speaker: JEROME
turns.text: It was a mercy-killing after all.

turns.speaker: IRENE
turns.text: They found an eyelash.

turns.speaker: JEROME
turns.text: Where?

turns.speaker: IRENE
turns.text: In the South Wing.

turns.speaker: JEROME
turns.text: Does it have a name?

turns.speaker: IRENE
turns.text: Just some In-Valid.  Vincent--  --somebody.

turns.speaker: JEROME
turns.text: Perhaps we ought to celebrate, Irene.

turns.speaker: IRENE
turns.text: You celebrate, Jerome?

turns.speaker: IRENE
turns.text: You didn't know?

turns.speaker: JEROME
turns.text: Yes...yes...

turns.speaker: IRENE
turns.text: You're angry--

turns.speaker: JEROME
turns.text: Why would I be angry?  It was beautiful.

turns.speaker: IRENE
turns.text: I envy you, Jerome.

turns.speaker: JEROME
turns.text: You'll be next.

turns.speaker: IRENE
turns.text: I don't think so.  The only trip I'll make in space is around the sun--  --on this satellite right here.

turns.speaker: IRENE
turns.text: It's here.  My heart.  I'm careful--weekly check-ups.  I'm on a drug maintenance program, blood thinners, diet--  I just want you to know what you'd be getting yourself into.

turns.speaker: JEROME
turns.text: What exactly is wrong?

turns.speaker: IRENE
turns.text: Nothing yet.  I'll start experiencing symptoms in my late-fifties.  But unless they come up with something between now and then, I won't live much past 67.

turns.speaker: IRENE
turns.text: Of course I think about it every day.

turns.speaker: JEROME
turns.text: Of course.

turns.speaker: IRENE
turns.text: So you didn't do it after all.

turns.speaker: JEROME
turns.text: I guess somebody beat me to it.

turns.speaker: IRENE
turns.text: What is this place?

turns.speaker: JEROME
turns.text: You've never been here?  Let me order for you.

turns.speaker: IRENE
turns.text: Why are we leaving?

turns.speaker: JEROME
turns.text: Those checks take forever.

turns.speaker: IRENE
turns.text: What about the car?

turns.speaker: JEROME
turns.text: Let's walk.

turns.speaker: IRENE
turns.text: Who are they?

turns.speaker: JEROME
turns.text: It's not safe.  I shouldn't have brought you here.

turns.speaker: IRENE
turns.text: I can't.

turns.speaker: JEROME
turns.text: Come on.

turns.speaker: IRENE
turns.text: My medication.  I left it back there.

turns.speaker: JEROME
turns.text: We'll get it later.  Irene, please.

turns.speaker: IRENE
turns.text: What happened?

turns.speaker: JEROME
turns.text: You remember the '99 Chrysler LeBaron? It's the exact height of the front fender.  Looked right instead of left.

turns.speaker: IRENE
turns.text: So you're not so smart after all. I want you to know--if it ever came to it-- I'd be willing to get an ovum from the Egg Bank. In fact, I'd rather use a donor egg-- --if it came to it.

turns.speaker: JEROME
turns.text: But "if it came to it" then it couldn't have your--  --nose.  How perfect does your child have to be?

turns.speaker: IRENE
turns.text: You hypocrite. Do you think for one moment you'd be doing what you're doing if it wasn't for who you are--what you are? Don't you get any satisfaction knowing that your children will be able to live to a ripe old age unless they do something foolish?

turns.speaker: JEROME
turns.text: That's precisely what scaresme--that they won't do anything foolish or courageous or anything--worth a Goddamn.

turns.speaker: IRENE
turns.text: What is it?

turns.speaker: JEROME
turns.text: I forgot something--something at home. I'll see you later.

turns.speaker: IRENE
turns.text: --when you go away.

turns.speaker: JEROME
turns.text: We could go together one day.

turns.speaker: JEROME
turns.text: A year is a long time.

turns.speaker: IRENE
turns.text: Not so long--just once around the sun.

turns.speaker: LAMAR
turns.text: Jerome...never shy.  Pisses on command. You've got a beautiful cock.  I ever told you that, Jerome?

turns.speaker: JEROME
turns.text: Only every time I'm in here.

turns.speaker: LAMAR
turns.text: If everything goes to plan, this could be the last time I see you for a while.  One week to go.  Please tell me you're the least bit excited.

turns.speaker: JEROME
turns.text: I'll tell you at the end of the week.

turns.speaker: LAMAR
turns.text: I've got enough here.

turns.speaker: JEROME
turns.text: Need any more, you can always get it off his shoes.

turns.speaker: JEROME
turns.text: What's this, Lamar?

turns.speaker: LAMAR
turns.text: New policy.

turns.speaker: LAMAR
turns.text: Flight got you nervous?

turns.speaker: JEROME
turns.text: There's a problem, Lamar.

turns.speaker: LAMAR
turns.text: Did I ever tell you about my son, Jerome?  He's a big fan of yours.  He wants to apply here.

turns.speaker: JEROME
turns.text: Just remember, Lamar, I could have gone up and back and nobody would have been the wiser--

turns.speaker: LAMAR
turns.text: --Unfortunately my son's not all that they promised.  But then, who know what he could do.

turns.speaker: NURSE
turns.text: What are you doing?

turns.speaker: MARIA
turns.text: I can't do this.

turns.speaker: NURSE
turns.text: I told you, the government pays.  It's all taken care of.

turns.speaker: MARIA
turns.text: No, you don't understand. I can't.

turns.speaker: NURSE
turns.text: The doctor will give you something.

turns.speaker: MARIA
turns.text: I'm not doing it.

turns.speaker: NURSE
turns.text: Honey, you've made one mistake--

turns.speaker: NURSE
turns.text: --I've read your profile.  I don't know about the father but you carry enough hereditary factors on your own.  You can have other children.

turns.speaker: MARIA
turns.text: Not like this one.

turns.speaker: NURSE
turns.text: Honey, look around you. The world doesn't want one like that one.

turns.speaker: NURSE
turns.text: The name?  For the certificate.

turns.speaker: MARIA
turns.text: Antonio--

turns.speaker: DOC
turns.text: You gotta be kidding.

turns.speaker: BEYNON
turns.text: Not at all, just a pleasant way to have lunch.

turns.speaker: DOC
turns.text: All it takes is a long arm.

turns.speaker: BEYNON
turns.text: Hard to judge how these things happen. The Parole Board almost never reverses their decisions.

turns.speaker: DOC
turns.text: I guess it was because I was a model prisoner.

turns.speaker: BEYNON
turns.text: This is the only time you and I meet in public. Any business with me, handle it with him...

turns.speaker: BEYNON
turns.text: You're back with your own people now. Got you some professionals.

turns.speaker: DOC
turns.text: I get my own help.

turns.speaker: BEYNON
turns.text: You run the job, but I run the show. You got two weeks to set it up.

turns.speaker: DOC
turns.text: What about them?

turns.speaker: BEYNON
turns.text: They're mine. The one with the moustache is my brother. They stay out of it. We stay clean.

turns.speaker: BEYNON
turns.text: Rudy Butler, Frank Jackson...

turns.speaker: DOC
turns.text: I heard about you. You work with Miller.

turns.speaker: DOC
turns.text: Sure,  You're working on the passports...  ... and visas?

turns.speaker: BEYNON
turns.text: They will be ready. You guys do your job.

turns.speaker: DOC
turns.text: I'll take care of my end.

turns.speaker: BEYNON
turns.text: Stay clean.

turns.speaker: BEYNON
turns.text: Hello, McCoy.

turns.speaker: DOC
turns.text: Beynon.

turns.speaker: BEYNON
turns.text: News said two persons killed.

turns.speaker: DOC
turns.text: Three... Rudy got ambitious.

turns.speaker: BEYNON
turns.text: And you got him...

turns.speaker: DOC
turns.text: That's right.

turns.speaker: BEYNON
turns.text: What about your wife?

turns.speaker: DOC
turns.text: What about her?  Let's c ut up the money, I want to get North.

turns.speaker: DOC
turns.text: You hired Jackson and Rudy., not me.

turns.speaker: BEYNON
turns.text: They may nail me into this now, McCoy.

turns.speaker: DOC
turns.text: That's your problem.

turns.speaker: BEYNON
turns.text: You know, you and I may be two of a kind.

turns.speaker: DOC
turns.text: No way. I always do my own work.

turns.speaker: DOC
turns.text: I'm in a hurry.

turns.speaker: BEYNON
turns.text: You still don't get the picture do you? I've always heard what a smart ass operator you are.

turns.speaker: DOC
turns.text: No applause!

turns.speaker: BEYNON
turns.text: A simple reason, McCoy. The obvious reason. To rob a bank.

turns.speaker: DOC
turns.text: I knew that life didn't add up to the obvious when I was 8.

turns.speaker: BEYNON
turns.text: What do you add up to here?

turns.speaker: DOC
turns.text: One. The radio's rappin' about $750^000. We only got a half a million.

turns.speaker: BEYNON
turns.text: A little more was taken out before.  My brother's a director of that Bank, Mr. McCoy... I had a few pressing debts.

turns.speaker: DOC
turns.text: So we did that crackerbox... to cover for you.

turns.speaker: BEYNON
turns.text: The obvious.  But we are both not interested in that right now.

turns.speaker: DOC
turns.text: No.  My old lady must have made a lot of promises.

turns.speaker: BEYNON
turns.text: Close... but it takes a hell of a lot more than promises to pull the kind of strings I pulled.

turns.speaker: DOC
turns.text: I bet.

turns.speaker: BEYNON
turns.text: Don't think too badly of her... After all, you were in jail a long time and she is a healthy young woman.

turns.speaker: DOC
turns.text: Get it over with...

turns.speaker: CAROL
turns.text: We'll try again.

turns.speaker: DOC
turns.text: No way. I've got to get out now.

turns.speaker: CAROL
turns.text: Hello, Doc.

turns.speaker: DOC
turns.text: Hi.

turns.speaker: CAROL
turns.text: You okay?

turns.speaker: DOC
turns.text: I'm a lot better off than I was an hour ago.

turns.speaker: CAROL
turns.text: You want to drive?

turns.speaker: DOC
turns.text: My license expired, let's get out of here.

turns.speaker: CAROL
turns.text: Sure...

turns.speaker: CAROL
turns.text: I'm sorry I was late... I got my hair done... the girl was slow.

turns.speaker: DOC
turns.text: It looks fine.

turns.speaker: CAROL
turns.text: Feel good?

turns.speaker: DOC
turns.text: Yeah.

turns.speaker: CAROL
turns.text: Where do you want to go?

turns.speaker: DOC
turns.text: I want to take a walk.

turns.speaker: DOC
turns.text: It doesn't look like that.

turns.speaker: CAROL
turns.text: What do you mean? You've never been there.

turns.speaker: DOC
turns.text: I've been there every day for the last four years.

turns.speaker: DOC
turns.text: What's Beynon got set up?

turns.speaker: CAROL
turns.text: Small town, small bank, big money.

turns.speaker: DOC
turns.text: Where did you get those?

turns.speaker: CAROL
turns.text: I've been doing my homework.

turns.speaker: DOC
turns.text: Just like old times?

turns.speaker: CAROL
turns.text: Better than old times.

turns.speaker: DOC
turns.text: I hope so. I am not looking forward to another stretch.

turns.speaker: CAROL
turns.text: I made a mistake. I'll never make another one.

turns.speaker: DOC
turns.text: Where did you get them developed?

turns.speaker: CAROL
turns.text: Assumed name... Houston.

turns.speaker: DOC
turns.text: Good.

turns.speaker: CAROL
turns.text: Half a million.

turns.speaker: DOC
turns.text: That Beynon's got a long arm.

turns.speaker: CAROL
turns.text: What do you want for dinner?

turns.speaker: DOC
turns.text: Whisky and a peach.

turns.speaker: CAROL
turns.text: How does it taste?

turns.speaker: DOC
turns.text: Just the way I remembered.

turns.speaker: DOC
turns.text: You been okay?

turns.speaker: CAROL
turns.text: Pretty good... Made a quick trip to Oregon, saw my brother and the kids. Figured it would be my last chance, unless they wanted to travel.

turns.speaker: DOC
turns.text: How's Estelle?

turns.speaker: CAROL
turns.text: Fatter... some things never change.

turns.speaker: DOC
turns.text: Boring.

turns.speaker: CAROL
turns.text: Nothing's been boring since you found me.

turns.speaker: DOC
turns.text: That's not all of it.

turns.speaker: CAROL
turns.text: No. It's been a long time.

turns.speaker: DOC
turns.text: You go out much?

turns.speaker: CAROL
turns.text: After four years and now the question comes up.

turns.speaker: DOC
turns.text: Couldn't handle it then. Now I can.

turns.speaker: CAROL
turns.text: I'm still here, Doc.

turns.speaker: DOC
turns.text: I guess I'm kind of...

turns.speaker: CAROL
turns.text: It's all right.

turns.speaker: DOC
turns.text: It's just been a while.

turns.speaker: CAROL
turns.text: We've got time. We've got a lot of time. I can help you.

turns.speaker: DOC
turns.text: Wait... give me a minute.

turns.speaker: CAROL
turns.text: Sure.

turns.speaker: DOC
turns.text: I'll be okay.

turns.speaker: CAROL
turns.text: Listen, I'm just as nervous as you are.

turns.speaker: DOC
turns.text: Really?

turns.speaker: CAROL
turns.text: Really.

turns.speaker: CAROL
turns.text: How was it?

turns.speaker: DOC
turns.text: Better than I remembered.

turns.speaker: CAROL
turns.text: I was going to fix you breakfast.

turns.speaker: DOC
turns.text: You were asleep.

turns.speaker: CAROL
turns.text: I bought you a lot of new things.

turns.speaker: DOC
turns.text: Yeah, well, I think I'll stick with what I've got.

turns.speaker: CAROL
turns.text: Suit yourself.

turns.speaker: CAROL
turns.text: $250,000 right off the top.

turns.speaker: DOC
turns.text: Is he straight?

turns.speaker: CAROL
turns.text: You got the parole, didn't you?

turns.speaker: DOC
turns.text: Thanks again.  I 'm glad you waited.

turns.speaker: CAROL
turns.text: I couldn't have... much longer.

turns.speaker: DOC
turns.text: Yeah... I know.

turns.speaker: CAROL
turns.text: But I got you out. Didn't I, Doc. I did it. I got you out.

turns.speaker: DOC
turns.text: Why are you laughing?

turns.speaker: CAROL
turns.text: I laugh when I feel happy. Sometimes just thinking of you made me laugh. I had a lot of that. And other times that wasn't enough. I had a lot of that too. I know you find it hard to believe, I'm happy just loving you.

turns.speaker: DOC
turns.text: That doesn't hurt.

turns.speaker: CAROL
turns.text: But sometimes I cried a lot too.

turns.speaker: DOC
turns.text: I didn't. I just waited.

turns.speaker: CAROL
turns.text: Want to cry now?

turns.speaker: DOC
turns.text: ... Bank President, three tellers and one guard...

turns.speaker: CAROL
turns.text: Usually on the right side as you go in.

turns.speaker: DOC
turns.text: Nail him first, be careful he doesn't panic and want to shoot somebody. Local police have one car, a rover, shouldn't be in the vicinity at the time we hit unless it's answering an emergency call... if the cop car shows up remember it doesn't have any automatic weapons. Only a shotgun braced on the dashboard. Get into a tight spot, you'll be out of range at forty yards. Then they're down to their side guns.

turns.speaker: CAROL
turns.text: For exits off Main Street.

turns.speaker: DOC
turns.text: Should be light traffic that time of day... the Bank Guard carries a .38. These will stop an M.2 at fifty yards.

turns.speaker: DOC
turns.text: Keep going over these. I don't want anybody getting lost.

turns.speaker: CAROL
turns.text: If we are clean Gollie will take us over at Nogales. If we are hot we'll have to try Laughlin at El Paso.

turns.speaker: CAROL
turns.text: You know how I feel?

turns.speaker: DOC
turns.text: My mind's not on guessing games.

turns.speaker: CAROL
turns.text: Promise you won't laugh.

turns.speaker: DOC
turns.text: If it's funny I'm going to laugh.

turns.speaker: CAROL
turns.text: I feel like the night before the first day of school.

turns.speaker: DOC
turns.text: That bad?

turns.speaker: CAROL
turns.text: It will be such a relief not to have to think about it any more.

turns.speaker: DOC
turns.text: Waiting's hard. You never learn how.

turns.speaker: CAROL
turns.text: You know I've actually gotten tired waiting sometimes... worn out waiting.

turns.speaker: DOC
turns.text: At least you were outside.

turns.speaker: CAROL
turns.text: It doesn!t make much difference where you are, if you're waiting, Doc.

turns.speaker: DOC
turns.text: Bullshit.

turns.speaker: CAROL
turns.text: I mean it.

turns.speaker: DOC
turns.text: I know you do. But it is different.  It's different.  We'll be all right tomorrow.

turns.speaker: CAROL
turns.text: We are always going to be all right tomorrow. I'd like to be all right a few todays.

turns.speaker: DOC
turns.text: We're going to have a lot of those,  We're just going to get the money and then go all the way.

turns.speaker: CAROL
turns.text: ... and live happily ever after.

turns.speaker: CAROL
turns.text: What about the bank?

turns.speaker: DOC
turns.text: Jackson panicked and nailed the guard.

turns.speaker: CAROL
turns.text: Doc...

turns.speaker: DOC
turns.text: I see it...

turns.speaker: DOC
turns.text: They checked in.

turns.speaker: CAROL
turns.text: Call the ranch, tell Beynotr we'll leave his cut here --

turns.speaker: DOC
turns.text: Why?

turns.speaker: CAROL
turns.text: There are three men dead.

turns.speaker: DOC
turns.text: So what. I've got to give him his money. That was our end of the deal.

turns.speaker: CAROL
turns.text: He might be ready to chop us up.

turns.speaker: DOC
turns.text: Do it my way.

turns.speaker: DOC
turns.text: Tell me about Beynon's ranch.

turns.speaker: CAROL
turns.text: I've never "been there... When we met it was in his office.

turns.speaker: CAROL
turns.text: Do you trust him?

turns.speaker: DOC
turns.text: I just figure the percentages. He wouldn't try a cross until he's got the money.

turns.speaker: CAROL
turns.text: Let's send his cut back -- Just keep going.

turns.speaker: DOC
turns.text: If we make a mistake., he'll burn us. You make a deal, you're always better keeping your end up.

turns.speaker: CAROL
turns.text: I don't want to go there.

turns.speaker: DOC
turns.text: Do it my way.

turns.speaker: DOC
turns.text: Why didn't you tell me?

turns.speaker: CAROL
turns.text: There wasn't any way to explain it.

turns.speaker: DOC
turns.text: Yeah.

turns.speaker: CAROL
turns.text: You sent me to him.

turns.speaker: DOC
turns.text: When I got out, why didn't you tell me where it was?

turns.speaker: CAROL
turns.text: What the hell do you want? Mary Tyler Moore?

turns.speaker: DOC
turns.text: Who's she?

turns.speaker: CAROL
turns.text: She's on TV.

turns.speaker: DOC
turns.text: If you don't start telling the truth...

turns.speaker: CAROL
turns.text: What do we do?

turns.speaker: DOC
turns.text: We keep going.

turns.speaker: CAROL
turns.text: A man helped me open it...

turns.speaker: DOC
turns.text: And switched keys.

turns.speaker: CAROL
turns.text: He must have.

turns.speaker: DOC
turns.text: It isn't another boyfriend, is it?

turns.speaker: DOC
turns.text: How long ago.

turns.speaker: CAROL
turns.text: Fifteen minutes.

turns.speaker: DOC
turns.text: Sure?

turns.speaker: DOC
turns.text: There better be a guy with the

turns.speaker: CAROL
turns.text: You bastard...

turns.speaker: DOC
turns.text: Your kind of mistakes are going to land me back in Huntsville.

turns.speaker: CAROL
turns.text: I wouldn't worry Doc. I can always get you out... I'll screw every prison official in Texas if I have to.

turns.speaker: DOC
turns.text: Texas is a big state.

turns.speaker: CAROL
turns.text: I can handle it.

turns.speaker: DOC
turns.text: I'll bet you can.

turns.speaker: CAROL
turns.text: You'd do the same for me, wouldn't you, Doc?  If I was caught, wouldn't you?
